programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a £50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit a Norwich couple who were worried about stepping on to the property ladder after being dissuaded by surveys. The property gurus also check on the progress of an extended family from Sutton Coldfield who wanted one big house, but could not agree where to live.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas run the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton, and hope to provide boutique on a budget, but veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Children's food educator Beth Stephens hosts the first dinner party in Lowestoft, Suffolk, where she plans to impress her guests - caravan site owner Ray, beauty therapist Polly, housing officer Jonalt and ASBO officer Rachel - with locally sourced seasonal food. However, she and Rachel gang up on Ray for most of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Caravan park owner Ray hosts the second night in Lowestoft, where he hopes to win the £1,000 prize with a Spanish-themed evening, complete with a homemade tropical zone and an Ibiza-style club night in a barn - despite it being the middle of winter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Luxury-loving beautician Polly hosts the third evening in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and is determined to prove she is more than just a pretty face. She opts for a fine-dining menu that stresses quality over quantity, and hopes her smart dress code will bring out the genteel side of her guests - but distractions soon emerge in the form of revelations about Ray once being a new romantic.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Albanian-born civil servant Jonalt hosts the fourth party of the competition in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and hopes his family recipes can impress his guests. He demonstrates a hidden talent that makes the diners laugh, and one contestant is left feeling the heat when Beth and Rachel unite.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a Cambridgeshire home for Mary and David, who recently became parents for the first time. However, they are also challenged to find a house for the baby's maternal grandparents Edna and George, who have moved to the area to be close to their extended family.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Stephen and Janis Pigeon from Buckinghamshire want to make a permanent move to the western Costa del Sol, with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Architectural designer Charlie Luxton visits a modern thatched home shaped like a giant letter S on the island of Lewis and Harris in north-west Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: The young TV viewers offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on First Dates, Nature's Weirdest Events and classic movie Dirty Dancing. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Pipestone, Minnesota, where he checks in to Historic Calumet Inn. Joint owners Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the hotel as a gift by their father, but after just nine months in charge, their staff are on the brink of revolt, and guests are expressing their dissatisfaction with the accommodation. Gordon quickly realises the sisters need to grow up fast if he's going to have a chance of saving the business. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The founder and president of the Tilted Kilt Pub & Eatery chain of sports bars hopes to see how his staff operate by posing as a failed business owner taking part in a bogus reality TV show. Ron Lynch goes undercover to make sure his company's principles are being implemented by his corporate and kitchen staff alike.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: As the quiz show continues, Luke feels like he is being overlooked and takes his frustrations out on Mairead and Nick.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined around the tasting table by First Dates maitre d' Fred Sirieix, food writer William Sitwell, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put tea, croissants and barbecue pork ribs to the test. The quickfire public taste challenge involves rice pudding.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: More customers arrive at Prestige Pawnbrokers, including a woman and her son, who are hoping to secure a loan against a 71-carat tanzanite ring they bought from a home-shopping channel. Prestige boss James Constantinou takes a shine to a bespoke show motorbike, and must fight against his instinct to claim the vehicle for himself as he seeks a buyer. Plus, a collection of 500 handbags arrives for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit camel-racing couple Joe and Rebecca Fossett, who had outgrown their Warwickshire home and were hoping to spend their £700,000 budget on a place near their existing house but with eight acres of land. The duo also check on the progress of Nick and Katrina who were searching for a property in Jersey, to find out whether they took a safe option or went for something out of the ordinary.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees Andrew and James Widdas from the Rose and Crown confront their critics about their polyester bedding. Nigel and Pok U from the Bingham Townhouse have some explaining to do when it comes to their breakfast service, while Kev and Tor from Float by Boat are left in tears by the payments they receive.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hotel duty manager Andrew Carruthers hosts the first dinner party from Cumbria, where he hopes to impress his fellow diners with his hotel-themed evening, complete with five-star quality food including `early reservation fishcakes' and a `do not disturb truffle' in an attempt to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jonny Thompson hosts the second night in Cumbria, where he hopes to wow his guests with a meaty menu - and they get to see a lot more of him than they had bargained for.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eccentric sheepdog trainer Katy Cropper hosts the third dinner party in Cumbria, where she prepares `come a cropper' prawns al fresco, opens a bottle of Champagne with a Masai sword, and serves some potent home-made horseradish sauce. Aside from the food, a sheep-herding demonstration proves to be a hit with her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Holly Venning hosts the fourth dinner party from Cumbria and the food marketing manager wants to show her love for her home county through her menu. She prepares Cumbrian scallops and chorizo, followed by a traditional Cumberland sausage - but her Penrith fudge pudding doesn't appeal to everybody.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Wendy Tinnion helms the final event in Cumbria and decides to throw a Friday night disco for her fellow diners. However, her guests are in for a shock when they discover something unexpected about their host.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Kent search for their ideal homes. In Broadstairs, Caroline and Ian are hoping to find a house for their growing family, while twentysomethings Sophie and Niall are looking for their first property in Maidstone.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Berkshire charity worker Lynda Feymor find a place in Portugal's Eastern Algarve, looking at five properties within her budget of £175,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit camel-racing couple Joe and Rebecca Fossett, who had outgrown their Warwickshire home and were hoping to spend their £700,000 budget on a place near their existing house but with eight acres of land. The duo also check on the progress of Nick and Katrina who were searching for a property in Jersey, to find out whether they took a safe option or went for something out of the ordinary.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The presenters seek to inject some craft love into an uninspired bedroom. Furniture maker Robin Johnson gets a sewing lesson from Clemency Green when they make a quilt. She also tackles the art of Sgraffitto, while car maker Ant Anstead gets gooey making geometric candles, and there are some top needlepoint and pottery tips.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: Bear About the House: Living with My Supersized Pet
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between people and their exotic and potentially dangerous pets, including a seven-foot Russian bear who regularly has meals with his owners. Minnesota couple Mike and Valerie keep a one-ton buffalo that has to be showered in a car wash and goes on nights out to the local bar.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: The Princess Bride

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. This week, the Caddy family of Bristol trade places with the Williams family from Weston-super-Mare. The Caddys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a seven-bedroom home, while for the eight-strong Williams family, who are among the nation's poorest 10 per cent, the swap means leaving their rented three-bedroom house and enjoying a weekly budget of £1,700 instead of their usual £110.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Touching drama about the triumph over adversity of the diminutive Simon Birch. He believes that God has a plan for him and voices his opinions forcefully and wittily. While this gets him into trouble with the authorities, he inspires all those around him(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Glum writer Miles takes his soon-to-be-married friend Jack on a week-long tour of California's vineyards. But while Miles just wants to forget everything and enjoy the wine, Jack's there to sample the women. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman returns to his role in The Hustler as an ageing liquor salesman inspired by a talented youngster to take up the pool cue after a 25-year break. With the aid of the young man's girlfriend, he encourages his new-found apprentice to learn the hustler's art in backwater pool halls. It isn't long before both headstrong protege and mentor are gunning for the same big bucks(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: The early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career, from the late 1920s to the mid-1940s. His career spanned everything from oil, for which he cared little, to movies, casinos, and aviation - as he turned millions of dollars into billions(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-footballer teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Action and adventure erupt yet again when the evil mummy returns in this effects-laden sequel to the 1999 hit. In 1933, Rick and Evie's son Alex joins the gang to take on the resurrected Imhotep, who's battling the Scorpion King for world domination. Brendan Fraser, Arnold Vosloo, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Oded Fehr, Freddie Boath(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Courtroom drama in which two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: An unconventional English teacher uses poetry to instil some spirit and freedom of thought into a class of private school students. Drama(n)

programme.title: Last Orders
programme.desc: An impressive cast of veteran British actors stars in this adaptation of Graham Swift's novel. Three working-class friends (Bob Hoskins, David Hemmings, Tom Courtenay) mourn the loss of one of their own but are determined to honor the dead man's wishes. Michael Caine, Helen Mirren, Ray Winstone, JJ Field, Kelly Reilly, Laura Morelli. Written and directed by Fred Schepisi(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: Joe Buck is the son and grandson of Texas prostitutes. A loser all his life, he decides to move to New York and make a living as a gigolo. His trip northward by bus is a brief tour of the seamy side of the American heartland. Joe hits the big city, yet finds the same sense of doom and despair that he thought he had left behind is waiting for him along the sleezy boulevards of New York's Times Square. There he meets Ratso Rizzo, another outcast, who lives in an abandoned building and makes his living as a cheap, two-bit hustler(n)

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark Waters's teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

programme.title: Happy Gilmore
programme.desc: Adam Sandler's second popular starring vehicle after Billy Madison is a goofy lowbrow paean to golf, hockey, and the comic hysterics of its childlike star. In Happy Gilmore, Sandler plays the title character, a raw, determined, but ultimately untalented hockey player who keeps trying out for the pros. When Happy discovers his grandmother (Frances Bay) will lose her home if she doesn't fork over 270,000 dollars to the IRS, he tries to figure out how he can possibly scrounge up the cash. An idea strikes during a game of one-upmanship with a couple furniture movers stripping his grandmother's home: On his first-ever swing, he drives a golf ball farther than the movers have ever seen. Before long, he has transplanted the foul-mouthed, aggressive persona of the hockey rink to the links, winning an amateur tourney that earns him a spot on the pro tour. Throttling everyone from a helpless caddy to game show host Bob Barker during the course of his 90-day quest to amass prize money, Happy also wins the sport a legion of new fans with his in-your-face style. Guiding him on his quest is a whimsical retired pro who lost his hand to an alligator (Carl Weathers) and an attractive public relations woman charmed by Happy's antics (Julie Bowen). Opposing him, however, is sneering hotshot Shooter McGavin (Christopher McDonald), who will do anything to win his championship jacket and see Happy fail(n)

programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a piece of land in Kent, a flat in London and a semi-detached property in Durham. They then speak to the buyers about how much they paid for them at auction, and what their plans are for the future.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Two siblings whose parents died in the Boxing Day tsunami of 2004 try to help two teenage brothers who lost their mum and brother. Aled Jones presents.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: After a contamination led to thousands having to boil their tap water, Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate how consumer supplies are kept clean.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A mother and son take on a mother and daughter at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh. Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the teams while Anita Manning leads proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Brian provokes Sharon, Bridget is tempted by an old flame, and a young man suffers the dark side of a loan shark. Drama, starring Sean Mahon and Jane McGrath.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple with a passion for dogs and horses seek a dream country home in Norfolk for £850,000, Sonali Shah tries to find them a property with enough land for their animals.(n)

programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: The search for a Salford gang member leads the UK's National Crime Agency and detectives from Amsterdam to a small village in the Netherlands. And in Leeds, a grandmother with a history of dealing in amphetamines back home in Poland discovers West Yorkshire police have tracked her down.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Mick is stunned to learn Whitney's fiance is former Vic bar manager Woody - how will he react? Steven is relieved when Abi calls Lauren home from the hospital - only for Max to turn up, warning him he must tell Lauren the truth. Keanu surprises Bernadette with a present for the baby.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Newly appointed and keen to impress, Nina is intent on an innovative path and strikes a deal with a face from the past - but may yet come to regret it. Party animal Morven is determined to remain professional despite a number of obstacles, but then makes a regretful decision. When Sacha boasts about his new `lady friend', the team members are eager to meet her, but none are prepared for what unfolds on Keller ward.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen finds herself in more danger as the investigation pulls her further into Manchester's criminal underworld. Paranoid, vulnerable but unperturbed, she tracks down the gang responsible for the shooting - before the case throws up some shocking revelations. And can Theo cheat death as the gang continues to be hunted by a mystery gunman? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama, with a guest appearance from Vincent Regan.(n)

programme.title: Orkney: When the Boat Comes In
programme.desc: The small island chain off the north-eastern tip of Scotland will be visited by more than 120,000 passengers from cruise liners, and on its busiest days the capital Kirkwall will see its population of 7,000 almost double. As part of the Our Lives strand, this documentary focuses on the impact of these tourists on the lives of Orcadians, with their arrival bringing much-needed revenue but also a growing concern about the environmental impact and for Orkney's world famous Neolithic sites, including Skara Brae.(n)

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers are taken by surprise with the unexpected birth of a sea lion pup, while one of the park's best known giraffes has become very sick, and vets cannot work out why.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned - two bungalows in Devon, a terrace house in Stoke-on-Trent and a Glasgow flat - before speaking to the buyers about their plans, and later visiting to see how the new owners have fared.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back

programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross help two teams to try make a profit at auction.(n)

programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is property shopping in Cambridgeshire with a couple of young newlyweds with a budget of £800,000, who want to escape London in favour of the serenity of the country.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless

At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: A compilation of celebrities over the age of 60 reflecting on their experiences of growing old, as they meet with remarkable members of the public and look back on archive footage.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox investigate the claims of big name estate agents, and singer Ricky Wilson explores why ticketing websites provoke so many complaints. Plus, Rogue Traders exposes a business lying to customers in order to sell them parts they do not need. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Wigan.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his crack team of builders, plasterers and electricians come to the aid of Frank and Christine Burrows in Wigan, Greater Manchester. In 2012, the Burrows' 35-year-old son Mark retrained as a scaffolder to follow in his father's footsteps, but was paralysed as the result of an unprovoked attack that left him with severe brain damage. Mark now needs constant care, but the Burrows' family home is not yet fit for purpose, so Frank and Christine have been forced to take their son to a care home 15 miles away. With the help of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen, Nick's experts set about constructing a self-contained apartment alongside the Burrows' two-bedroom bungalow, which will provide Mark with the space, independence and security he will need to return home for good after spending two years away.(n)

programme.title: Olly Alexander: Growing up Gay
programme.desc: The Years & Years lead singer explores why the gay community is more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battle with depression. Olly joins young people on their own personal journeys as they battle issues that parallel his own, from homophobic bullying to eating and anxiety disorders, and questions what can be done to address them.(n)

programme.title: I'm Coming Out
programme.desc: Young adults come out to their parents about their sexuality, revealing how hard it still is to be gay 50 years after the decriminalisation of homosexuality. In the first episode, cameras follow 18-year-old Ross, who grew up in an isolated Cumbrian town, as he films himself coming out to his parents after keeping his sexuality hidden from his family and his local community.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Joe Swash joins presenter Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that shaped him into a much-loved character actor. Vivid memories from his childhood recalled, courtesy of wacky character Grotbags. Joe then reveals which army drama was watched religiously in the Swash household, before touching on a docu-drama series that had the nation the edge of its seats.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle return to Longleat Safari Park as it enters its busiest time of the year, witnessing the giraffes making their way to their summer paddock.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Lewes, East Sussex, as experts Philip Serrell and Nick Hall help two teams to find three items to sell at auction.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Dave and Harry Rich transform gardens around the country within the owners' budgets, beginning at a terraced home in York.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Josh Overington creates a fish stew made up of champagne, lobster, scallops and truffles, while Danny Parker creates a dish of scallop served with grapes and apple. And Tommy Banks uses turbot to create a meal inspired by the iconic Wimbledon food, strawberries and cream, but will which will impress the latest veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman presents this four-part documentary charting how the First World War affected the lives of the British people and created what is known as modern Britain. The first film focuses on the early stages of the conflict, the announcement of which led to stunned disbelief, followed by a mass recruitment drive as volunteers signed up to fight. With the fear of invasion gripping the country, even Boy Scouts were engaged to help guard bridges, and for the first time British civilians were bombed from the air and fired on by enemy ships. Jeremy hears from a 105-year-old eyewitness to one such attack - the shelling of Hartlepool in December 1914.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore North Yorkshire, beginning in the city of York, where Brian samples delicacies at a food shop. They enjoy a picnic on Sutton Bank hill, before Janet is given a private tour of Ampleforth Abbey's chapel and its antique furniture. The day's celebratory dish is roast porchetta with bread pudding and cider brandy glazed apples.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of economic recipes, including a Bake Off masterclass featuring Sussex suet pond pudding, and a James Martin tomato soup with garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: The Great Rift: Africa's Wild Heart
programme.desc: How the diverse array of waterways in East Africa's Great Rift Valley - including rivers, coral seas, caustic springs and waterfalls - helps to sustain the region's wildlife. A wide variety of birds, animals and fish rely on the water for survival, and many have evolved to adapt to the challenges posed by the area's geography.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Saba's guests are accidentally stranded at a remote airstrip in the scorching African sun, as the summer heats up, and the race is on to pick them up, while Saba prepares the camp for their arrival. Meanwhile, husband Frank puts himself on the frontline in the fight against ivory poachers.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough offers an insight into insect-eating animals, including shrews that dive under water, moles that can `swim' in the Namib Desert, and New Zealand bats that hunt in packs on the ground, walking on their wrists and foraging. Plus, how hedgehogs and armadillos liven up their diet with fruit and birds' eggs, while pangolins and giant anteaters survive entirely on a diet of insects.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Tredegar House near Newport in Wales, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles. Items of interest include a tapestry woven in tribute to Status Quo, a carved coconut steeped in 18th-century maritime history and a frog-shaped brooch. A former Mastermind champion shows off the glass vase he won, and a Second World War veteran tells the story of a daring mission to inspect German defences before the D-Day landings - and how he came to have a packet of cigarettes from Field Marshal Rommel.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Sir Gareth Edwards at 70
programme.desc: Gabby Logan invites the rugby legend to reflect on his life and career with the help of a celebrity audience, performances and archive footage of his greatest moments. Gareth looks back on his achievements, from Welsh Grand Slams and British & Irish Lions triumphs to his prowess in World Superstars, which saw him compete against the greatest sportsmen on the planet. Guests paying tribute include Sian Phillips, Rob Brydon, Max Boyce, Sean Fitzpatrick, Matthew Rhys and Bryn Terfel, while there is also a surprise contribution from the Duke of Cambridge in his role as patron of the Welsh Rugby Union.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace investigates Europe's largest biscuit factory in London, while Cherry Healey looks into the chocolate added to the beloved digestive. Plus, Ruth Goodman examines the link between biscuits and digestion.(n)

programme.title: Is It Safe to Be Gay in the UK
programme.desc: With homophobic hate crime a daily occurrence and on the rise in the UK, this film takes a look at the issue, and tells the stories of the victims, their families and the police that deal with the attacks. To explore the ongoing issue, this film hears from a chorus of LGBT victims who recall their experiences, and discuss how they dealt with such unprovoked attacks, simply for being who they are.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: After recent revelations, Lance, Andy, Becky and Sophie are trying to come to terms with an uncertain future. Terry puts his emergency plan into action - but it will help only one of them. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Queer as Art
programme.desc: The BBC continues to mark the 50th anniversary of decriminalisation of male homosexuality in the UK with its Gay Britannia season. This time, the focus falls on the LGBT contribution to the arts scene in the past half-decade, as Stephen Fry, David Hockney, Anthony Sher, Alan Cumming, Will Young and Alan Hollinghurst share their perspectives on the distinctive voices the community has brought to British cultural life. Also includes contributions by Val McDermid, Wayne Sleep, Julie Goodyear, Sandi Toksvig, Russell T Davies and many more.(n)

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova.(n)

programme.title: How to Holiday Better
programme.desc: Cherry Healey and Ade Adepitan find the perfect holiday for members of the public. Plus, Richard Madeley and Steph McGovern present guides to Venice and Oman.(n)

programme.title: Bus Wars
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the fierce competition between big bus tour companies in Belfast as they fight for a share of the lucrative tourist market. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Myleene Klass to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with her selection including Fraggle Rock, Neighbours and The Wonder Years.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At Longleat Safari Park, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover how a reluctant rhino is encouraged to take a mud bath, and cameras follow the arrival of lethal tarantulas.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A mother and son take on a mother and daughter at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh. Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the teams while Anita Manning leads proceedings.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates whether the recent terror attacks in London and Manchester have created divisions amongst the deaf community.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The North East chefs go all out to impress with their main courses, as they compete for a chance to cook at the Taste of Summer banquet. Tommy Banks creates a dish inspired by Wimbledon's guard of honour, Danny Parker tries to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue, and Josh Overington presents a main course inspired by memories of his grandfather.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his history of the First World War with a look at the crisis the country faced as it became clear Britain was unprepared to fight a modern industrial conflict. As a result, the entire adult population was enlisted to turn the country into a war machine - from the women who filled the factories to make bombs and bullets to the men sent to the frontline. Not everyone agreed with the war, but any conscientious objectors who refused to fight were threatened with the firing squad, while striking shipbuilders were sent to jail. And with resources in short supply, even the nation's beer was watered down on government orders.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to the Thames to explore the area's history and culinary offerings. They hike along the river's path to find Two Hoots cheese-makers, a family run business famous for its goats cheese. Janet learns all about Henley and the story of its regatta before rounding up some hungry rowers for Brian to feed with roast Aylesbury duck, olives and turnips at the Leander Rowing Club.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of old-school recipes. They include Keith Floyd's Irish stew, the Hairy Bikers' meatloaf, James Martin's ultimate bacon butty, a treacle tart from Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, and a chili con carne from Lorraine Pascale.(n)

programme.title: The Great Rift: Africa's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the grasslands of east Africa, and a line of volcanos stretching from Ethiopia to Tanzania, whose peaks provide a refuge for many wildlife species - which use surprising strategies to survive in such a challenging environment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The drought begins to make everyday life difficult for the people and animals in Kenya's Samburu National Park, and Saba's plan to track down elephants for her guests goes wrong. Frank is concerned about a herd of young orphaned elephants heading into danger with no leader to guide them to safety.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Tredegar House near Newport. Among the finds are a locket that was a gift from Queen Victoria, a device used for creating tattoos, a classic car, a cigar cutter commemorating the opening of the Newport transporter bridge, 19th-century advertisements for public executions, a versatile tiara and a miniature font with a sad history.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Former Strictly Come Dancing partners Zoe Ball and Ian Waite join experts Margie Cooper and Paul Laidlaw on a quest to find items to sell at an auction in Hampshire. Their search takes them through the south-west of England, with Paul telling Zoe a secret about buying antique hair brushes, while Ian offers dancing lessons to dealers to secure a discount.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Victorian Treat.
programme.desc: This time, confectioners Paul, Cynthia, Andy and Diana use original recipes to recreate a Victorian sweet shop, and discover how the quest to satisfy our national sweet tooth transformed Britain. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the sweet-makers head to Blists Hill, Shropshire, to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 19th and early 20th century England. The team recreate a range of Victorian treats to stock their sweet shop, from jars of boiled sweets to their own version of fruit pastilles, and an enormous Easter egg. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Man Up
programme.desc: Premiere. While traveling across London to attend a party to celebrate her parents' 10th wedding anniversary, a thirtysomething single woman is mistaken for a recently divorced stranger's blind date, so decides to spend a chaotic evening with him. However, she has to face the consequences when he realises she is not his intended blind date. Romantic comedy, starring Lake Bell and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Birds of Paradise: The Ultimate Quest
programme.desc: Part one of two. Thirty years ago explorer Benedict Allen lived in Papua New Guinea with the Niowra, a remote people. Broadcast journalist Frank Gardner has always wished to see wild birds of paradise, so Benedict resolves to take him along. The duo set out through some of the most inhospitable terrain on the planet, negotiating swamps, mountains and crocodile-infested waters, heading into the cloud forest. Despite Frank requiring the use of a wheelchair following a shooting incident in 2004, Benedict determines to get him to their destination.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe goes aboard the HMS Pickle to tell the remarkable story of the ship that took part in the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805 and was used to deliver the news of victory to the nation because its small size and revolutionary design made it faster than its bigger counterparts.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Tsunamis.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart explores the destructive power of the sea, examining the devastation that can be caused by underwater volcanic eruptions and sub-aqua tectonic activity. He also reveals wartime plans to harness tsunamis as weapons, and examines the story of two men who successfully surfed the tallest wave in history. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: Explorers: Conquest and Calamity - A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: Fara Dabhoiwala trawls five decades of the BBC archive to explore how documentary-makers have shifted their attitude toward explorers over the past five decades.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: It is 1987, and with Aids hitting the headlines, a new part looks like a game-changer for actor Phil. Monologue, starring Russell Tovey and written by Brian Fillis.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Alice and her husband share a secret, though the publication of the Wolfenden Report in 1957 may change all that. Monologue, starring Rebecca Front, and written by Jon Bradfield.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Scott's Hut
programme.desc: Ben Fogle travels to Antarctica, where he joins a project hoping to preserve the hut from which explorer Captain Robert Scott launched his ill-fated polar expedition in 1911. The building, located on the remote Cape Evans, has remained practically untouched and contains thousands of items left behind by Scott and his team. The programme also features extracts from the explorer's diaries, read by Kenneth Branagh, as well as contributions by David Attenborough and Ranulph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: Gunpowder 5/11: The Greatest Terror Plot
programme.desc: For the very first time the inner secrets of the Gunpowder Plot of 1605 are revealed in this landmark docudrama. It uses the actual words of the senior captured leader Thomas Wintour and Guy Fawkes as they responded to the state interrogators who were investigating the conspiracy by a Catholic-led group of militants to blow up Parliament and King James I, which had taken 18 months to plan. Also included is an insight into the recruitment of Fawkes and Wintour's brother right up to the dramatic siege that resulted in their capture on November 8. This epic tale reveals the plotters' faith, betrayal and persecution - and uncovers the truth behind a scheme whose ruination is celebrated every year.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Tsunamis.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart explores the destructive power of the sea, examining the devastation that can be caused by underwater volcanic eruptions and sub-aqua tectonic activity. He also reveals wartime plans to harness tsunamis as weapons, and examines the story of two men who successfully surfed the tallest wave in history. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Earth
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski presents this documentary showing how new camera technology is revealing the inner workings of the Earth's most spectacular natural wonders. The first programme looks at the anatomy of an avalanche, from eyewitness footage from within one to detailed CT scans showing the microscopic changes that cause them.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: Explorers: Conquest and Calamity - A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: Fara Dabhoiwala trawls five decades of the BBC archive to explore how documentary-makers have shifted their attitude toward explorers over the past five decades.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe discovers why the development of square riggers in the 19th century was one of the most beneficial advances in maritime history. He explores how these boats transported goods all over the world, and sets foot on a plank-perfect reproduction to reveal how the use of these vessels transformed Britain into one of the most powerful nations.(n)

programme.title: Inside Einstein's Mind: The Enigma of Space and Time
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates a docudrama exploring the story behind Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity, which turned science's understanding of gravity, space and time on its head when it was published in November 1915. The film takes viewers on a visual journey that begins in Einstein's young mind, follows the thought experiments that gave him stunning insights about the physical world and ultimately reaches the extremes of modern physics.(n)

programme.title: Hyper Evolution: Rise of the Robots
programme.desc: Dr Ben Garrod and Professor Danielle George explore the unsettling question of what it could mean for humanity if robotic machines were able to develop consciousness. The pair come face-to-face with a range of creations, including Kirobo, a machine designed to be a companion on the International Space station, and iCub, a robot that is forming his own unique understanding of the world around him.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As far as dapper gent Jackie is concerned, the 1967 Sexual Offences Act may not be as revolutionary as it appears. Monologue delivered by Ian Gelder. Written by Matthew Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As the Blitz hits London, Fredrick is grateful he survived in a very unlikely place of refuge. Monologue delivered by Kadiff Kirwan. Written by Keith Jarrett.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Is Your Brain Male or Female?.
programme.desc: Research suggests the connections in men's and women's brains follow different patterns, which might explain typical forms of gender-specific behaviour. Dr Michael Mosley and Professor Alice Roberts investigate whether these are innate or are shaped by the outside world, using a team of human guinea pigs and a troop of Barbary apes to test the science and challenge old stereotypes. They ask whether this new scientific research will benefit both sexes or drive them even further apart.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Logic
programme.desc: Computer scientist Dave Cliff provides a light-hearted look at the worlds of philosophy, mathematics, science and technology, all of which require a sound basis of logic. The professor creates the world's first child-run computer, and meets youngsters competing in the International Olympiad of Informatics in Brisbane, Australia, before assessing whether mankind can stay ahead in the field of logistics, or whether it is in danger of creating a machine smarter than the most logical human mind.(n)

programme.desc: Calvin Lee, an executive naval officer, appears to commit suicide by hanging himself from a public road bridge. When examining CCTV footage of the incident, Sam and Callen discover the dead man tossed away a small object before jumping to his death, and when they learn the late lieutenant commander had been working on a sensitive project involving new cloaking technology for submarines, they immediately take an interest in the item. The investigation draws the team into the furtive world of LA's Chinese community, where they discover Lee might have been harbouring some personal as well as professional secrets. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.desc: Missiles are stolen from the SeaTac base, and later turn up in a car belonging to a military weapons expert. Rabb and Austin are quick to pinpoint a suspect - but a prison break-out soon complicates matters. David James Elliott stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Calvin Lee, an executive naval officer, appears to commit suicide by hanging himself from a public road bridge. When examining CCTV footage of the incident, Sam and Callen discover the dead man tossed away a small object before jumping to his death, and when they learn the late lieutenant commander had been working on a sensitive project involving new cloaking technology for submarines, they immediately take an interest in the item. The investigation draws the team into the furtive world of LA's Chinese community, where they discover Lee might have been harbouring some personal as well as professional secrets. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan's insufferable sister discovers a dead estate estate agent in her new house - and the medical sleuth's investigation throws up no shortage of suspects. Dick Van Dyke stars.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A father rejects his dying daughter and the son she had out of wedlock. Starring and directed by Michael Landon, with Lorne Greene.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss and Joe come to the rescue when Mexican farmers are forced off a greedy mine owner's land in the town of Prince River.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. The team's initial inquiries turn up little concrete information about the victim's life, but the forensic specialist makes a breakthrough when she decodes some of the mysterious markings covering the body. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A young girl witnesses a violent crime committed by the Mob, putting her life in danger. The Rangers act as bodyguards as well as investigating the murder of a policeman.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Harm and Meg are called in to defend a US soldier jailed by Iraqi forces for crossing into enemy territory. David James Elliott stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A naval officer involved in an illegal underground street race is killed when his vehicle explodes. The team's investigations reveal he was carrying classified equipment in relation to his work on a new form of battery that the military had hoped to adopt, and that the explosion - captured on CCTV - is not in accordance with that expected of normal fuel. Meanwhile, Callen latest driving misdemeanour means he must attend traffic school. Chris O'Donnell stars.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A successful boxer is found murdered shortly after a bout, so Jack steps into the ring to catch the culprit. Detective drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs receives a call from his old friend Senator Patrick Kiley, who claims he is being framed for the murder of a naval commander, and seeks help to clear his name. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. However, Tony Sr's experience turns out to play a vital role in the inquiry, which finds the team members hunting for a missing nuclear weapon they suspect is about to be sold on the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.desc: Vince decides to give Will a symbolic birthday present to celebrate their relationship - but Grace tries to talk him out of it, knowing how her friend is likely to react. programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen and Grace are given the job of decorating the home of a newlywed couple, but become increasingly bitter as the job revives painful memories of their own divorces. Meanwhile, Will and Jack try to save a bookshop from closure.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray grows tired of Debra's cooking and asks Marie to teach her how to make his favourite dish - spaghetti and meatballs - leading to chaos in the kitchen. Starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray runs into trouble while trying to show Debra he can take over the running of the family finances, and resorts to a series of elaborate lies to get himself out of the mess he has created. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink bumps into a former friend of Martin's while visiting Maris in hospital. The pair parted on bad terms, so Frasier tries to effect a reconciliation. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A plumber hired to repair Frasier's toilet turns out to be the bully who made Niles' life a misery at school. Comedy, guest starring John C McGinley, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz falls out with Frasier and accepts an offer from Bulldog to produce his show instead. Comedy, starring Peri Gilpin, Dan Butler and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart uses a radio transmitter to trick the townsfolk of Springfield into thinking a child has fallen down a disused well. As events get out of hand, he is forced to own up and face the music - but has difficulty making amends. Featuring the guest voice of Sting.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa begins to feel increasingly neglected by Homer and tries to worm her way into his affections by feigning an interest in American football. Amazingly, she soon shows an aptitude for predicting the outcome of games - an ability that sets him off on an amazing but ill-fated run of betting success.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Yorkshire compete to throw the perfect dinner party, with Jodie and her fiance Rob kicking off the competition. On the second night, middle-aged love-birds Neil and Claire host a night of homely sophistication, and finally, ambitious professionals Ben and Samara go all-out and attempt to recreate their Greek wedding menu.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: More customers arrive at Prestige Pawnbrokers, including a woman and her son, who are hoping to secure a loan against a 71-carat tanzanite ring they bought from a home-shopping channel. Prestige boss James Constantinou takes a shine to a bespoke show motorbike, and must fight against his instinct to claim the vehicle for himself as he seeks a buyer. Plus, a collection of 500 handbags arrives for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Kate Humble joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: As the quiz show continues, Luke feels like he is being overlooked and takes his frustrations out on Mairead and Nick.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows sun-worshippers Carol and Junior Smith from Middlesex five properties on Spain's popular Mar Menor in the hope one will meet their approval.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Four dinner parties in Woking and Guildford, featuring professional cake decorator Mignonne, part-time musician Neil, barmaid Julie and performance manager Daniel.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart perform street magic in a bid to impress passers-by and raise enough cash to pay a mechanic's bill. Unfortunately, they quickly realise people are suckers for a sob story, and start conning the public for money. Featuring the guest voice of Edward Norton.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Harry books his and Ste's wedding to give Ste something to live for, while Diane tells Misbah some home truths. Elsewhere, Lisa is furious about Scott stealing the beach bar idea, but Damon is smitten and forgives Scott, as long as he gets him a date with Lisa.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The presenters seek to inject some craft love into an uninspired bedroom. Furniture maker Robin Johnson gets a sewing lesson from Clemency Green when they make a quilt. She also tackles the art of Sgraffitto, while car maker Ant Anstead gets gooey making geometric candles, and there are some top needlepoint and pottery tips.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Part one of two. For six weeks, 10 four year olds will share their classroom with 11 pensioners. In an experiment led by three geriatric specialists, the young and older group follow the same timetable in a new nursery set within a retirement village near Bristol. The senior group will undergo tests to measure mood, memory and mobility during their daily interaction with the kids.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Croydon mates Josh and Jack take part in a double date, but problems arise after they meet Morgan and Jasmine, and both fall for the same girl. Meanwhile, divorced mum-of-two Sandy hopes to find romance with an astrology expert Steve, though incompatible star signs may be a problem. And tomboy boat-builder Abbey returns to the restaurant, but will she find a soul mate in Eddie, an odd job man who's nervous around women?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: Sound and Vision
programme.desc: With help from Fuse ODG, Afro B, Eugy and Team Salut, Billie JD Porter explores how important UK Afrobeats has been in renewing a sense of pride in African culture. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemies: Jay-Z vs Kanye
programme.desc: Documentary charting the rise to fame of the rappers and how their hopes and ambitions led to a falling out between them, featuring previously unseen footage and interviews with the people who know them best. The film tells the story of a creative partnership spanning two decades and reveals an even bigger story of how race, wealth and celebrity are shaping modern America.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet videos, including a game of table tennis being played with kitchen knives and a sound system pumping out bass so loud it turns a car to jelly.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: The young TV viewers offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on First Dates, Nature's Weirdest Events and classic movie Dirty Dancing. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers in London. The programme's youngest-ever house-hunter, 18-year-old student Claire Winship, has had cerebral palsy from birth and uses a wheelchair. With a budget of £1.7million, she wants a property with good investment potential, plenty of accessible space and a view of the Thames. Meanwhile, trainee fashion buyer Geri and her carpenter boyfriend Arran are looking for a one-bedroom flat near Crouch End in north London, and have £280,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners inspect rival vendors' homes for decor inspiration. In Cardiff, a couple add glamour to their 1930s house, two more add warmth to their minimal terrace and a final pair realise they must clear their collection of cat clutter to make a sale to buyers Ellery and Christian.(n)

programme.desc: The transporters bid on a steel horse sculpture worth £95,000 which needs to be moved 96 miles from Hampshire to the Chelsea Flower Show in London. Laurie comes out on top, but she gets off to a faltering start due to an unfamiliar trailer. Plus, Shahbaz runs into trouble at the bronze statue drop-off, and Russell ends up spending a night at the zoo.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free

programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.desc: Frasier attempts to work his psychoanalysis on a self-confessed lazy criminal, who has stolen his briefcase and car and is masquerading as the `real' Frasier Crane. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Lane, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.desc: Attractive and popular psychologist Dr Honey Snow dates Frasier, who is so flattered that he agrees to write the introduction to her latest book - a decision that later causes him a king-size crisis of conscience. Guest starring Shannon Tweed.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: New series. As one door closes, another one opens. No sooner has Channel 5 crowned its latest Big Brother winner, it reopens the house to make way for a fresh batch of contestants - but this time, of course, the new reality residents are all famous faces. Cue a roll call of soap actors, reality stars and glamour models, with the odd Loose Women presenter and US star thrown in for good measure. As always, Emma Willis introduces each one as they enter, ready to have their every word and move recorded for the enjoyment of the viewing public. It's to be hoped BB fans don't have anything else planned for the next few weeks.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell offers an insight into the history, design and building process of the Britannia Bridge, across the Menai Strait between the island of Anglesey and the mainland of Wales. The difficult task of building the 100ft iron structure was taken up by civil engineer Robert Stephenson and his team, including William Fairbairn and Eaton Hodgkinson. But in May 1970, four youths set light to the famous bridge, and Rob meets a fireman who fought the blaze that fateful night.(n)

programme.desc: The Montreal ePrix. Action from the two races staged at the Montreal Street Circuit, which served as the 11th and 12th rounds of the season, which brought the campaign to a close.(n)

programme.desc: A toddler has her heart valve operation delayed after developing a nasty head cold, and a young woman dealing with anxiety and insomnia visits the surgery.
