programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd is off to Cornwall to visit a field kitchen at HMS Raleigh, the new-entry training establishment for all ratings joining the Royal Navy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd prepares chicken with peppers and cream for the crew of a French trawler in Newlyn, Cornwall, and rustles up pork Normande for the owner of a pig farm. The chef also meets the man in charge of the Cornish Smoked Fish Co in Chatlestown.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John explores the inventive way Koreans use vegetables, eats a veg-heavy boribap lunch, and styles some mung bean pancakes in his Gangnam kitchen.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, in which the judges ask them to make a dessert of their own invention from a selection of ten ingredients, including whole almonds, apples, strawberries and mascarpone cheese. After two more chefs are sent home, the remaining contestants must prepare a two course menu of their own design for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers head for East Anglia, where they meet three women who provide examples of meals that have become family favourites. The pair also visit the coast to prepare sausage and bean casserole and jam roly-poly with custard, and a recipe fair highlights more home-cooked classics, including trifle, fruit cake and macaroni cheese.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal recalls the 1970s heyday of the ice-cream van and tries to kick-start a revival of this ailing British tradition by planning to build the world's biggest 99 Flake - taller than five metres and weighing in at more than a ton. With Europe's largest ice-cream factory at his disposal, he begins production with help from some of the experts behind the 2012 Olympics, and plans to serve his creation from the back of a van in Gloucester.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by food found on the menus of British pubs fit to celebrate special occasions. Tom shows how to cook the perfect slow roast duck, served with potato pancakes and braised lettuce, as well as spiced monkfish with smoked aubergine puree, and a gin and tonic granita for dessert. Later, he heads to Whitstable in Kent to whip up a seaweed mayonnaise to use as a dip for deep-fried oyster fritters.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by classics of the British pub menu. He begins by making a simple Caesar salad, before showing how easy it is to whip up bar snacks such as pickled eggs, spicy nuts and pork scratchings. As a twist on the traditional roast, Tom cooks pork belly, lentils and cabbage salsa, and heads to Suffolk to prepare his take on fish and chips with locally caught brill. He finishes off by preparing a date and toffee pudding with a caramelised banana topping.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour

programme.desc: In the coastal state of Veracruz, the chef learns the technique of smoking jalapeno peppers into chipotles, and visits a vanilla plantation.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Enzo Mauro at his restaurant in Newbridge, Penzance, where he also talks to Nick Howells about salted pilchards. He then heads to Botallack Count House to cook rabbit, and spends time cooking shark steak in pinquant tomato sauce with Rick Stein at the Seafood Restaurant in Padstow.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd cooks boeuf en daube and pollacks in green pepper sauce at the home of Trish Norris in Newquay.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: The chef discovers more Korean culinary wonders. He visits historic Join, eats Royal Bibimbap and enjoys ?The taste of Korea in a bun'.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first three cooks face a Skills Test set by Monica Galetti who gives them 15 minutes to fillet a sea bream and cook it. Then Marcus Wareing sets the challenge for the next three contestants who have 20 minutes to make a watercress soup and serve it with poached eggs and fresh almonds. All six chefs then have one last chance to win over the judges in the second Signature Dish challenge.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers look across the Channel to see how the French have influenced British food over the centuries. They prepare a roast chicken with 40 cloves of garlic, and a delicate mille feuille, and examine UK products in traditionally French areas of gastronomy, from award-winning English wines to Scottish garlic.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal celebrates the tea break on a monumental scale, bringing the Lancashire town of Darwen together for a unique brew. He takes on the challenge of creating the world's biggest packet of biscuits - one metre in diameter and combining several of the nation's favourite varieties - and creates a huge pyramid-shaped tea bag, as well as a giant teapot to serve the crowds.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates how to make two roast dinners that provide an alternative to the average British Sunday lunch. He begins by marinating beef in treacle for 24 hours before serving it with crispy roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings, before moving on to a recipe of turbot wrapped in puff pastry, providing a meat-free take on beef Wellington. He finishes by creating a chocolate cake with muscovado cream, along with a light lemon posset.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef makes family dishes inspired by British pub fare, preparing smoked haddock and parmesan omelette and giving the traditional roast chicken a farmyard twist by baking it in hay. He also demonstrates his take on the classic baked beans on toast and creates an apple toffee crumble pie for dessert.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: The chef discovers more Korean culinary wonders. He visits historic Join, eats Royal Bibimbap and enjoys ?The taste of Korea in a bun'.(n)

programme.desc: In Oaxaca, the chef spends a week sampling an assortment of food from cheese to tamales - and even grasshoppers.(n)

programme.desc: The chef forages for bush tucker in the east coast's lotus-filled lakes and jungle.(n)

programme.title: New Best Friend
programme.desc: Three rich, pretty people befriend their poor, mousy classmate and live to regret it in this teen-centric thriller. Alicia (Mia Kirshner), Hadley (Meredith Monroe), Julianne (Rachel True), and Sydney (Dominique Swain) are four students enrolled in the same sociology class at Colby University, an exclusive and respected college in the Carolinas. Alicia is a local girl born into modest circumstances who struggles to make ends meet and rarely gets a second look from the male students on campus, while Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney are close friends who all come from wealthy families and seem more concerned with partying than their studies. Alicia and Hadley are paired up to work on their semester project for the class, which is to be centered around the theme "Lead, Follow, or Get Out of the Way." As part of the project, Hadley decides to befriend Alicia, and brings her into her social circle. At first, Alicia seems more than grateful for the attention of her new friends, and blooms under the influence of Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney. But it isn't long before Alicia's personality begins to shift; she develops a powerful appetite for drugs and alcohol, and soon begins taking advantage of her new friendships. Things come to a head when Alicia seduces Sydney's boyfriend, Josh (Oliver Hudson), and soon Alicia ends up in the hospital after OD'ing on drugs. Artie Bonner (Taye Diggs), a local sheriff, begins looking into Alicia's case, convinced that her near-fatal accident with drugs was no accident at all(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Scientist Bruce Banner (Edward Norton) have been living in shadows, seeking a cure to his unique condition, which causes him to turn into The Incredible Hulk, a giant green monster, under emotional stress. But the military forces who dream of abusing his powers won't leave him alone. Upon returning to civilization, Banner is ruthlessly pursued by a nightmarish beast whose powers match The Hulk's own. A fight of comic-book proportions ensues as Banner must call upon the hero within to rescue New York City from total destruction(n)

programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 174. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio in this madcap action comedy(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella Questions. A cryptic encounter tests Issa's interpretive skills; Lawrence mulls some important decisions; Molly plots to join the office "boys club" after being on the receiving end of a few harsh truths; Issa and Frieda deal with a difficult vice principal(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple are terrorized by three masked intruders at a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Bull Rush. Spencer goes to Las Vegas on business and gets reacquainted with an old flame who's working for Wayne. Meanwhile, Jason finds himself in a tough neighborhood after Joe sets him up to represent a top running back; Ricky challenges the odds in a game of dice; Charles gets a lesson in public speaking from Julie; and Vernon and Reggie mull a risky endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: New Best Friend
programme.desc: Three rich, pretty people befriend their poor, mousy classmate and live to regret it in this teen-centric thriller. Alicia (Mia Kirshner), Hadley (Meredith Monroe), Julianne (Rachel True), and Sydney (Dominique Swain) are four students enrolled in the same sociology class at Colby University, an exclusive and respected college in the Carolinas. Alicia is a local girl born into modest circumstances who struggles to make ends meet and rarely gets a second look from the male students on campus, while Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney are close friends who all come from wealthy families and seem more concerned with partying than their studies. Alicia and Hadley are paired up to work on their semester project for the class, which is to be centered around the theme "Lead, Follow, or Get Out of the Way." As part of the project, Hadley decides to befriend Alicia, and brings her into her social circle. At first, Alicia seems more than grateful for the attention of her new friends, and blooms under the influence of Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney. But it isn't long before Alicia's personality begins to shift; she develops a powerful appetite for drugs and alcohol, and soon begins taking advantage of her new friendships. Things come to a head when Alicia seduces Sydney's boyfriend, Josh (Oliver Hudson), and soon Alicia ends up in the hospital after OD'ing on drugs. Artie Bonner (Taye Diggs), a local sheriff, begins looking into Alicia's case, convinced that her near-fatal accident with drugs was no accident at all(n)

programme.title: Love Liza
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman stars as a man grappling with his wife's suicide in this incisive character study written by his brother Gordy(n)

programme.title: Transmission Test 60-min - English
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Homeless: The Motel Kids Of Orange County
Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Comedy adventure set during the Vietnam War about a group of US soldiers who attempt to bring an elephant through the jungle for a friendly native village. A pair of army officers offer to find a new elephant for local villagers when their sacred beast becomes a casualty of war. Along with a trio of hapless assistants, they set off on a mission to deliver the animal to its new home(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy Dog
programme.desc: Disney family comedy about a lawyer who, after being bitten by a hound with mystical powers, is horrified to discover that he periodically and uncontrollably turns into a sheepdog. He must try and keep both his family and his head together as he investigates sinister goings-on at a medical research facility(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier is asked to get back into her habit when her old friends at St Catherine's Convent find difficulty in controlling a school filled with juvenile delinquents. But convincing everyone that Deloris is a nun is going to be a challenge in itself(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realize that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Scientist Bruce Banner (Edward Norton) have been living in shadows, seeking a cure to his unique condition, which causes him to turn into The Incredible Hulk, a giant green monster, under emotional stress. But the military forces who dream of abusing his powers won't leave him alone. Upon returning to civilization, Banner is ruthlessly pursued by a nightmarish beast whose powers match The Hulk's own. A fight of comic-book proportions ensues as Banner must call upon the hero within to rescue New York City from total destruction(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 175. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A cop looking for a quieter way of life is thrown into the most dangerous crisis of his life in this thriller based on the novel by Robert Crais. Jeff Talley (Bruce Willis) used to be a hostage negotiator with the Los Angeles Police Department, but after a standoff goes horribly wrong, Talley moves himself and his family to a small, quiet town of Bristo Camino, where he serves as chief of police. When three young criminals attempt to steal a car from a wealthy accountant, the situation quickly spins out of control and the thieves are trapped inside the heavily fortified home, taking the accountant and his family hostage. The Ventura County Sheriff's Department soon arrives on the scene, and Talley eagerly hands over the situation to them, but when he unexpectedly finds himself in telephone contact with one of the children inside, he begins to suspect that the cops are in over their heads. After he's approached by a masked stranger who has an agenda of his own, Talley is forced to decide if he should protect the safety of the family in the house or his own wife and kids. Hostage was the first English-language film from director Florent Emilio Siri(n)

programme.title: The Fight Game With Jim Lampley
programme.desc: 06/14/2017. An interview with Sergey Kovalev; a breakdown of the Andre Ward-Kovalev rematch; a recap of Terence Crawford's New York fight; and a look back at the David Tua vs. Ike Ibeabuchi 1997 heavyweight bout(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: Newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan adopt an unruly Labrador puppy who despite being "the world's most disobedient dog" becomes a key part of their lives(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: A lonely writer begins a relationship with his hyper- intelligent computer operating system(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action tale about a super-tough LA cop who single-handedly confronts a vicious group of killers who are terrorising his neighbourhood. When an attractive model observes one of the killings, the cop is forced to flee town with the witness, and the thugs in hot pursuit(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: The surprise Japanese attack is the backdrop of a love triangle involving a nurse and two fighter pilots(n)

programme.title: Making 'Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising'
programme.desc: A look at "Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising," a sequel to the 2014 comedy that finds a young couple plagued by yet another Greek menace: the sisters of Kappa Kappa Nu. The film stars Seth Rogen, Zac Efron and Chloë Grace Moretz, and is directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water
programme.desc: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water. A report on South Sudan and how rampant corruption has brought the country to the brink of collapse just six years after winning independence; a chronicle of months of protesting by activists in North Dakota against the Dakota Access Pipeline(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-30-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Queen's Justice. Daenerys holds court; Cersei returns a gift; Jaime learns from his mistakes(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella Questions. A cryptic encounter tests Issa's interpretive skills; Lawrence mulls some important decisions; Molly plots to join the office "boys club" after being on the receiving end of a few harsh truths; Issa and Frieda deal with a difficult vice principal(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: A lonely writer begins a relationship with his hyper- intelligent computer operating system(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: A look at the dangerous world of camel racing; a report on the debate over Native American mascots; and a study of the injury rate among cheerleaders. Correspondents include Bernard Goldberg and Frank Deford(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Now fully recovered from his amnesia, Bourne teams up with Nicky Parsons (Julia Stiles) to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. Paul Greengrass returns to helm this sequel, which co-stars Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander, Riz Ahmed, and Vincent Cassel(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez stars in this true story of Texas born singer Selena Quintanilla-Perez, who rose from cult status to becoming one of the biggest stars in Latin Music(n)

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: A motorbike prodigy joins an underground racing club and ruffles feathers when he challenges the club's unbeaten champ(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: This biopic of airline pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger depicts his successful emergency landing of an Airbus A320 on the Hudson River in January 2009. In the aftermath of this unprecedented feat, he must endure the weight of sudden fame, second-guessing by investigators and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: Kaulder (Vin Diesel), a witch hunter, is cursed with immortality by the Witch Queen (Julie Englbrecht) right before she dies at his hand. As a result, he has been tracking down evil witches for centuries while leading a lonely existence separated from his wife and daughter. When the Witch Queen returns from the dead seeking retribution, a battle ensues and the fate of humanity hangs in the balance. Directed by Breck Eisner (The Crazies). Cast includes Elijah Wood, Rose Leslie, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson and Michael Caine(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: This Oscar-winning comedy drama stars Matt Damon as a mathematical genius, struggling to come to terms with his talent and the trauma in his life, and Robin Williams as the psychologist trying to help him. Will Hunting is a night janitor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology who hangs out with a tough-talking Irish-American crowd of buddies and hides the fact of his genius like a guilty secret. The secret is discovered by a professor who, when Will is ordered to undergo therapy for his aggression, introduces him to a psychologist who reaches out to the kid, learning much about his own pain in the process(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-30-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Ralphie. Extraordinary stories that occur in a single room at a nondescript U.S. motel over the course of several decades are told in this anthology series, which begins with a babysitter arriving at Room 104 to watch an unusual boy(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich stars in this highly-stylized action-horror film as a soldier in an elite unit that's called to infiltrate a subterranean lab when a deadly virus is released. Their mission turns deadly, however, when they encounter zombie lab workers and a murderous supercomputer(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use his power to bring about the fall of his new female boss, but love begins to bloom between them and he finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks as though it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Mel Gibson directed this biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss (played here by Andrew Garfield). A conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon, Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. Hugo Weaving, Teresa Palmer, Vince Vaughn, and Sam Worthington co-star in Gibson's return to the director's seat(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: Fun 80's comedy with Goldie Hawn landing a menial government job in Washington and soon finding herself embroiled in some major dealings across the globe(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Humorist Dave Barry's comic novel is the basis for this frenetic romp, set in Miami. It's the story of a crazy group of people whose lives interconnect. Included: a Pulitzer Prize-winning columnist; a nasty industrialist; his put-upon wife; hit men; and a philosophical street person(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use his power to bring about the fall of his new female boss, but love begins to bloom between them and he finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks as though it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube and Chris Tucker (star of the Rush Hour movies) are two LA guys hanging out on a Friday - Ice Cube's just been fired from his job but Tucker has a more serious concern - he smoked rather than sold the $200 stash of dope he got from Faizon Love. Now the two have a choice - find the money by the end of the day or enter a whole world of pain in F Gary Gray's black comedy(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson takes his comic creation 'Mr Bean' to Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: A lovelorn woman has all but given up trying to find Mr Right when she meets a mysterious and attractive estate agent at a nightclub. However, the man disappears before the woman can get to know him. With the help of her friends, she sets out on an eventful road trip to track down her would-be lover at his brother's wedding(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube and Chris Tucker (star of the Rush Hour movies) are two LA guys hanging out on a Friday - Ice Cube's just been fired from his job but Tucker has a more serious concern - he smoked rather than sold the $200 stash of dope he got from Faizon Love. Now the two have a choice - find the money by the end of the day or enter a whole world of pain in F Gary Gray's black comedy(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube returns as South Central L.A. slacker Craig Jones for this raucous sequel to 1995's "Friday." Jones hightails it to his lottery-winning uncle's suburban crib to hide from an escaped con he helped put in jail in the first film. Tom "Tiny" Lister Jr., Mike Epps, John Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: Self-centred TV talk show host Roscoe goes home to Georgia, where he's put back in his place(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: Lonely kid Nicholas Hoult finds a reluctant father figure in detached bachelor Hugh Grant in this heartwarming comedy based on a book by Nick Hornby. With Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: This sequel to the 1980 comedy "The Blues Brothers" finds brother Elwood released from jail and looking to re-form the band with a burly bartender after the death of brother Jake(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Continental Divide
programme.desc: Cynical reporter Ernie is sent out of town by his editor when one of his investigations ends in death threats. So he's dispatched to interview an eagle conservationist in the mountains(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: Vulgar, slapstick comedy abounds in this feature film debut for television sitcom star Kelsey Grammer. Almost everyone else thinks of Lieutenant Commander Tom Dodge is a class "A" goof who messes up every task he is assigned, but Adm. Dean Winslow thinks otherwise and decides to give Dodge one last chance by assigning him to helm an outmoded, diesel powered, rusty in a series of wargames. Dodge's sub is to be the enemy and must somehow outsmart their high tech opponents. Though ostensibly only games, Admiral Yancy Graham, who considers Dodge an embarrassment to the Navy, decides to do everything he can to scuttle Dodge and his ragtag crew's mission(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: A drug shipment is sent to the wrong address, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before its contents are revealed in this hilarious crime comedy. Brody (Mike Epps) and Guch have mistakenly received a package containing 10 kilos of cocaine. If they can just find a buyer, they'll be rich. Meanwhile, intended recipients Jesus and Chita try to track down the shipment before drug lord Bodego Diablo realizes it's missing. But Bodega already knows the score and he wants his drugs(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Off-beat comedy-drama starring Jeff Bridges as an unreconstructed hippy who calls himself The Dude. When he is visited by gangsters mistaking him for a wealthy industrialist known as the Big Lebowski, the Dude seeks out his namesake and is soon embroiled in a complex scheme which he has no hope of understanding, let alone surviving. This quirky film from the idiosyncratic Coen brothers was a hit with the critics and features the first ever point-of-view shot from inside a bowling ball. It's that kind of movie(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

But the military forces who dream of abusing his powers won't leave him alone. Upon returning to civilization, Banner is ruthlessly pursued by a nightmarish beast whose powers match The Hulk's own. A fight of comic-book proportions ensues as Banner must call upon the hero within to rescue New York City from total destruction(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Mel Gibson directed this biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss (played here by Andrew Garfield). A conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon, Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. Hugo Weaving, Teresa Palmer, Vince Vaughn, and Sam Worthington co-star in Gibson's return to the director's seat(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: When a bumbling movie lover becomes magnetized while attempting to sabotage a local power plant and accidentally erases all of the videotapes in the small video store where his best friend works, the pair attempt to keep the store's loyal customer base by remaking as many of the top-renting movies as possible. Mike (Mos Def) is an employee at Be Kind Rewind, a modest mom and pop video store that is owned by Mr. Fletcher (Danny Glover). Mike's best friend Jerry (Jack Black) works in an auto garage/junkyard directly adjacent to a local power plant. Lately Jerry has become increasingly paranoid about the effects that the power plant is having on his health. Convinced that he has developed a brain tumor from working in such close proximity to the power plant, Jerry attempts to sabotage the plant. Unfortunately for Jerry, his brain is magnetized in the process. The next time Jerry goes to visit Mike at Be Kind Rewind, the powerful magnetization emanating from his brain erases every videotape in the store. Now the only way for Mike and Jerry to be sure that Be Kind Rewind stays in business is to remake every film on the shelves before the customers notice. But when word gets out that Mike and Jerry have remade such Hollywood classics as Back to the Future, Robocop, The Lion King, and Rush Hour without permission, the store is threatened with copyright violations and forced to close its doors. In the aftermath of the closing, Mr. Fletcher and his employees discover just how loyal their customers really are when the entire neighborhood pools their resources to transform the junkyard into a legitimate movie studio and produce an entirely original film detailing the incredible adventures of a local jazz legend(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: Bret Easton Ellis's dark and violent satire of America in the 1980s is brought to the screen in this unsettling drama with blackly comic overtones. Patrick Bateman (Christian Bale), the son of a wealthy Wall Street financier, is pursuing his own lucrative career with his father's firm. Bateman is the prototypical yuppie, obsessed with success, fashion, and style. He is also a serial killer who murders, rapes, and mutilates both strangers and acquaintances without provocation or reason. Donald Kimble (Willem Dafoe), a police detective, questions Bateman about the disappearance of Paul Allen (Jared Leto), whom Patrick murdered several days earlier. As Kimble stays on Bateman's trail, Bateman's mask of studied, distant cool begins to fall apart. American Psycho also features Reese Witherspoon as Bateman's girlfriend, as well as Samantha Mathis, Chloe Sevigny, and Guinevere Turner; the latter also co-authored the screenplay. Controversy followed the production from the start, when speculation that Leonardo Di Caprio would play Bateman sparked concerns that he would lure preteens to an R-rated movie. Di Caprio soon bowed out of the project, and original leading man Bale was reinstated. Later, a group of Toronto residents attempted to block filming in that city after Canadian serial killer Paul Bernardo claimed that Ellis's novel inspired his murder spree(n)

programme.title: American Psycho II: All American Girl

If he fails, he must go back to Earth and try again. Since the executive had been a notoriously selfish coward during his earthly existence, he definitely has his work cut out for him(n)

programme.desc: A single and freewheeling travel writer finds that adapting to the nine-to-five lifestyle isn't as easy as it looks when her ailing father hires her to take control of his successful bridal magazine in this marriage-minded comedy starring Heather Graham, David Sutcliffe, Sandra Oh, and Taye Diggs. Upon returning to her hometown to once again be a bridesmaid in yet another wedding, jet-lagged, gin-soaked travel writer Pippa McGee (Graham) soon learns that her tyrannical publishing magnate father has been hospitalized after suffering a serious heart attack. As Pippa rushes to his bedside and the ailing mogul asks her to take editorial control of one of his most popular magazines, her excitement soon turns sour upon learning that the magazine in question is not a political or travel magazine, but the one and only Wedding Bells monthly. Determined to succeed despite the constant reminders of just how single she truly is, Pippa is horrified to learn that the man her father has chosen as her publishing mentor is the same man that she drunkenly came on to at her close friend's recent wedding(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: A demonic entity lays claim to family living in a secluded farmhouse, prompting them to seek the aid of two renowned paranormal researchers in this tale of possession inspired by actual events. The story gets underway as paranormal researchers Ed (Patrick Wilson) and Lorraine Warren (Vera Farmiga) evaluate a mysterious doll discovered by a trio of young roommates in 1968. Believing their house to be haunted by the wayward spirit of a deceased young girl, they give the girl permission to inhabit the doll, and soon their lives become a waking nightmare. Informed by Ed and Lorraine that they have fallen victim to an inhuman spirit (aka a demon) seeking a human host, the roommates entrust the doll to the Warrens, who place it in their personal museum for safekeeping. Flash forward three years to Harrisville, RI, where the Perron family have just moved into their country dream home -- an 18th century farmhouse that offers plenty of space for parents Carolyn (Lili Taylor) and Roger (Ron Livingston), as well as their five daughters Andrea (Shanley Caswell), Nancy (Hayley McFarland), Christine (Joey King), Cindy (Mackenzie Foy), and April (Kyla Deaver). It seems like the ideal place to raise a family until a series of unsettling events leave the Perron family convinced they are not alone. Terrified, Carolyn reaches out to the Warrens for help, and learns that a demonic entity has attached itself to her family, and has no intentions of letting them go. Meanwhile, the deeper the Warrens delve into the farmhouse's history, the clearer it becomes that this spirit has a murderous agenda, and that no one will be safe until it is driven back into darkness(n)

programme.title: American Wedding
programme.desc: The third film of the successful American Pie series, which started to shake the box-offices in 1999. Jim (Jason Biggs) is about to marry Michelle, while his crazy friends, Finch, Stifler and Kevin, still have their hormones somewhat worked up. Apart from rushing to make all the arrangements for the wedding, Jim must strive to gain the approval of his parents-in-law, and, to make matters worse, he has to battle with the restrictions of his grandmother, who is against the wedding because Michelle is not Jewish. In addition, the arrival of Cadence, the bride's youngest sister, completely upsets the situation. Finch and Stifler fall in love with her and start a heated dispute, where one of them is the rebel, and the other, prince charming. Of course, a crazy stag party could not be left out. The director of this film, Jesse Dylan, is Bob Dylan's son(n)

Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. programme.sub-title: Football: Audi Cup Live: Atletico Madrid v Napoli.

programme.desc: A fortune-teller helps the police with their investigation into an art theft, and proves astonishingly accurate in her predictions. Unfortunately, her next revelation concerns an attempt on Ironside's life. Raymond Burr stars.(n)

Action adventure, starring Denzel Washington, Gary Oldman, Mila Kunis, Ray Stevenson and Jennifer Beals.(n)

programme.desc: Detectives Preston and Shaw investigate the case of a woman who awakes to discover she has been attacked on a night out but has no memory of the violent encounter. Under the assumption that she has been drugged, the detectives call in her colleagues for questioning but when a picture of the victim is uploaded online, they are not sure that she is as innocent as she claims.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama set in the 1920s, starring Michael Kitchen as a downtrodden, henpecked solicitor who buys a quantity of arsenic to kill the dandelions on his lawn, and suddenly realises it could be used to solve the problem of his wife as well. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Yvonne is left fighting for her life after being involved in an accident while out mountain-biking with Cathy and Raz. Their arrival at St Victor's puts everyone under pressure to keep their emotions under control. Robert turns a blind eye when Mike carries out a procedure which goes against protocol, and Jack is hurt that Christine won't move in with him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is assaulted, and is shocked by the reaction of the Aidensfield residents when suspicion falls on a local policeman - until the attacker strikes again. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: James and Felicity's son Philip is sent back to the island on a secret mission for the British Army, but when he and his comrade Eugene are left without an escape route, they are forced to hide from the Germans in the loft of the Jonases' farmhouse. Meanwhile, the islanders re-open their businesses for the first time since the invasion but Cassie struggles to cope with serving the enemy. Baron von Rheingarten is given a tour of the island and stuns James by deciding to move into the Dorr family home. James Wilby, Sam Heughan and Philip Glenister star.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates the sudden reappearance of a local man last seen seven years previously, who turns up out of the blue and claims to be suffering from amnesia. Meanwhile, Greengrass receives a strange proposal from a man who seems to have taken the plot of Hitchcock's Strangers on a Train a bit too seriously.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel faces the task of informing Georgina that the man she loved has been killed in the war. Meanwhile, staff at Eaton Place begin to suspect anyone with German ancestry.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Yvonne is left fighting for her life after being involved in an accident while out mountain-biking with Cathy and Raz. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad, as a complex plot by a gang of dangerous dissidents sees a host of international figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard.(n)

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: David and Robyn are woken in the early hours by the police and David immediately assumes the worst, thinking something has happened to one of the children. A visit to the doctor confirms Adam's suspicions about Pete, and an adrenaline-fuelled bike ride fails to take Pete's mind off the situation. A visit to see care patient Harry (James Bolam) adds to Pete's woes when Harry makes a morose request and, in a bid to escape the pressures at home, Jenny's moment of madness at work comes back to haunt her.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is discovered on the Northumberland moors, and identified as a woman who made a distressed 999 call on the night of her death - suggesting she may have been abducted by someone she knew. Vera takes on the case, and discovers the victim was a controversial figure in her home town, who had a complicated relationship with her family and a number of well-hidden secrets.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Dawn and Russell's wedding reception at the pub is the scene for a number of confrontations, heart-to-hearts and surprises. Terry storms out after an argument with Steph, while the bride's father Len turns up unannounced but is he there to make amends or cause trouble? Later, Pauline bumps into Johnny and tells him untruths about Steph's feelings for him as she desperately tries to protect herself and Brian. Drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Sophie Rundle, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DS Ben Shaw and DI Jane Preston investigate when a hit-and-run incident leaves a cyclist fighting for his life in intensive care. They track down the owner of the car, who claims he was so intoxicated the night before that he does not recall a thing. However, his memory quickly returns as they begin unravelling the truth.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Nancy begins to feel the weight of her deception as her fling with Harry continues, while Mr Selfridge finds himself pushed into a corner when he clashes with Loxley at a shareholders' meeting. Reality soon hits home as Victor and Violette take a romantic trip to the coast, and George grows increasingly unhappy at the club. As Mr Grove struggles to face up to recent events, Miss Mardle offers her support, but beneath the surface she is racked with guilt - and when he finds out the truth, he makes a rash decision.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Bulstrode searches London for Robert, but does not realise he has fled into the countryside to hide out at the Jezequiel house, taking Ravi and Olalla with him. To his surprise, they are later joined by Lily, who claims to have guessed where he would go. However, Ravi begins to suspect the truth - that what they think is their friend is actually a shape-changing monster known as an Incubus. As the others fall under the monster's spell, it appears that the creature has the ability to restore Lord Trash to the land of the living.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel faces the task of informing Georgina that the man she loved has been killed in the war. Meanwhile, staff at Eaton Place begin to suspect anyone with German ancestry.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack decides to implement a new policy and Richard comes to suspect he and Christine are working as a team in more ways than one. Robert goes on the warpath over the new protocol and threatens to hand in his notice. Meanwhile, Judy's worst fears are confirmed after her father's operation, and the powers that be conspire to cover up a case of steroid abuse by a VIP's son. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Preston and Shaw investigate a case of arson at a home shared by security guard Peter and recruitment consultant Lizzie. The testy relationship between Peter and his brother David, the owner of the house, provides the officers with a suspect, but the revelation that the two cohabitors may be in a secret relationship opens up new lines of enquiry. Drama, starring Ben Hull and Jane Antrobus.(n)

programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part one of a three-part Victorian murder drama, starring Christine Kavanagh and Zoe Wanamaker. The Collard and Vandervent families are outwardly respectable, but inwardly they seethe with lust and greed. When Roger Vandervent dies under mysterious circumstances, his son Paul sets off on the investigative trail - one that will split families apart.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: James visits Philip and Eugene in their new hiding place and convinces the latter to give himself up to the Germans, unaware this will certainly mean his death. Harbour Master Wimmel threatens Cassie with imprisonment after her black market business is discovered, while Baron von Rheingarten and Felicity grow closer. James Wilby, Sam Heughan, Richard Dempsey and Saskia Reeves star.(n)

programme.desc: Kavanagh defends a left-wing activist accused of murdering someone from the opposite end of the political spectrum - and learns a harsh lesson in the process. To make matters worse, he finds out daughter Kate is having an affair with her married tutor, thus setting the scene for further fireworks. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman's attempt to cool her husband's ardour has unexpected and tragic consequences, while Greengrass takes up an illegal new hobby - cockfighting. Comedy, starring Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Daisy and Edward are married, but his return to the front line cuts short their happiness. At the station Georgina witnesses the arrival of a train filled with casualties, and decides to do something positive to assist the war effort.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Yvonne is left fighting for her life after being involved in an accident while out mountain-biking with Cathy and Raz. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: As the crime drama returns for its 13th and final series, Poirot finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. Elsewhere, the detective's old friend Ariadne Oliver is being pressed to uncover the truth behind two decade-old deaths. As the pair dig deep for evidence, they soon discover that their separate investigations are linked and join forces to solve the overarching mystery. David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town edges toward its conclusion in the penultimate episode, with important pieces of evidence coming to light against all the key suspects in the rape of Trish Winterman. Ellie and Hardy can feel the vice tightening on the culprit and know that the case will crack open soon. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of a young man's body in an area notorious for illicit teenage gatherings, the corpse wrapped in plastic sheeting and having received a blow to the head. Vera follows the trail to a funfair where the victim used to work and a church where he sought refuge, having recently been made homeless. She delves into his family history to discover why he was on the streets when his parents lived nearby, while forensic evidence implicates the son of the vicar, who has a criminal past.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA staff and volunteers are called in to remove almost 200 birds and mammals from an animal sanctuary after allegations of neglect. An investigator is just in time to save four chihuahuas from starvation, while nine dogs and four cats are rescued from a filthy house.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators are called in when a drugs raid also uncovers roosters kept for fighting, while Dana Moss rescues two dogs on the verge of giving birth.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Ginni Wood and her friend Kelly Gaskins who vanished in Texas during March 2007. A third person, Kelly's boyfriend Ervin Williams, also went missing. He was wanted by the police in Beaufort County, North Carolina, on several drug charges.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Crimes by the sorts of people seldom suspected, such as those with respectable jobs. Their often shocking white collar misdeeds prove a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: case in which two Los Angeles widows targeted homeless men to cash in on murder. Plus, the charismatic art investor who cheated Hollywood celebrities out of millions of dollars.(n)

programme.title: Judge Jeanine Pirro
programme.desc: Courtroom programme featuring prominent US legal commentator and former District Attorney and County Judge Jeanine Pirro as the presiding jurist.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The IRS analyses a number of unusual clues that help locate the kidnapper of a wealthy businessman's wife, who was abducted in 1988.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A cold case from 1957, in which a man committed several crimes in one night - including murder. California police followed numerous leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators made a breakthrough.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A New Jersey woman disappears without a trace, so police trail her husband and search for a box containing incriminating evidence against him.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old student Katie Poirier, who vanished while working the graveyard shift at a petrol station. CCTV footage revealed an answer - but left a community in fear.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: In 2004, a 31-year-old nurse died suddenly of kidney failure. When detectives looked into the affairs of her overly grieving husband, they discovered a web of lies and forgery.(n)

programme.title: Murder Shift
programme.desc: Following a team of homicide detectives in Indianapolis. A man is murdered, leaving Christine Minka and her partner Moore racing against time to catch his killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The murder of 54-year-old Pennsylvania landlady Beth Grosskopf in May 2009. Her tenant, Benjamin Dennerlein, stabbed her over 30 times after being threatened with eviction.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: How, after a baby was found abandoned along Ohio's Scioto River, police discovered the child's mother had been murdered. Officers considered whether the killer was connected to the woman's past.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.(n)

programme.title: Casey Anthony: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Recounting one of the most talked-about cases in US legal history, which began when 22-year-old Florida woman Casey Anthony claimed that her two-year-old daughter Caylee had been taken by her nanny. Investigators, however, soon discovered that the child has been missing for 31 days. Caylee's remains were later found wrapped in a blanket in woodland near her Florida home.(n)

programme.title: Scene of the Crime with Tony Harris
programme.desc: The mysterious case of Jeff Bradstreet, a doctor known for unusual autism treatments. His death was ruled a suicide, but the presenter contemplates whether it was more sinister.(n)

programme.title: Sin City Justice
programme.desc: A case in which two brothers sought justice for their parents' death in a drunk-driving incident. In a retrial, a defendant's brother testified against him for a possible death penalty.(n)

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: A case in which a couple realised their son was hiding an evil secret. George and Margaret Keller were forced to make a heartbreaking choice whether or not to betray their child.(n)

programme.title: Scene of the Crime with Tony Harris
programme.desc: The mysterious case of Jeff Bradstreet, a doctor known for unusual autism treatments. His death was ruled a suicide, but the presenter contemplates whether it was more sinister.(n)

programme.title: I Am Homicide
programme.desc: Homicide detective Garry McFadden revisits a case in which a warm-hearted waitress was gunned down in a carjacking gone wrong. The manhunt lasted many years.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How victims' family members and friends can assist police in their inquiries after the body of a missing person is found and identified.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator rescues ferrets abandoned in a house in freezing temperatures, and a colt is discovered in such a bad condition it cannot stand up.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Puppies are found abandoned in a ditch, and their chances of being rehomed are jeopardised by their health problems.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Jamie Fraley, who vanished from her North Carolina apartment in April 2008. Her keys and purse were found locked inside her apartment and there were no signs of foul play. Officers considered whether her boyfriend's father could be involved, after it emerged that he harboured a dark obsession with her.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The murder of 47-year-old Miriam Illes, who was shot through her kitchen window in January 1999. Her estranged husband Richard had a strong alibi, but suspicions remained and prints found in the snow from basketball shoes proved damning.(n)

programme.title: Murder Shift

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Kelly Eckart, an 18-year-old who disappeared after finishing her shift at an Indiana hardware store in September 1997. Her car was discovered abandoned by the side of the road, still running and four days later, her partially naked body was found in a ravine. Workman Michael Overstreet was eventually convicted of the crime after eyewitnesses reported seeing him in the area and DNA evidence provided a solid link.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV

programme.title: Murder Calls

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Amanda and Adam Cropper find a new home in the Thai province of Phuket, which they intend to use as a holiday home before they eventually move there permanently.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former How Clean is Your House? presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the glamourous Costa Del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £200,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Pauline Cox's Wharfe House in Wetherby, West Yorkshire, and a visit to a local vineyard sees a clash between guest Mike Hepker and Tash Thorne.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit Wortwell Hall Barn in Norfolk, run by husband-and-wife duo Clive and Jenny Aylett, but when the pair's rivals arrive, Pauline Cox and Claire Smith have difficulty locating their favourite appliance. Publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne are astonished to discover they cannot lock their room's door. In the morning, some of the guest make awkward requests to change their breakfast orders, causing professional chef Clive to experience a meltdown in the kitchen that leads to a fundamental error.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Bath Lodge Castle in Somerset for the third day of the competition, where they are wowed by Karen and Mike Hepker's luxury castle experience. Although the guests are disappointed at the bathroom fixtures and fittings, they are given the chance to vent their emotions during an afternoon of painting in the castle grounds. Plus, tensions rise between Mike and Tash at dinner, and harsh comments at feedback lead the hosts to suspect game playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The Old Lodge Hotel in Gosport, Hampshire, run by publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne. Karen Hepker is disappointed with the honeymoon suite, while Clive and Jenny Aylett find a dubious looking splash guard in the shower. A boat tour backfires when Jenny struggles with her water phobia and at dinner Karen takes the opportunity to tell the others exactly what she thinks of them. But things really kick off when it comes to feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wharfe House hosts Pauline Cox and Claire Smith begin a bitter debate, demanding to know why their beds caused such a sleepless night. Accusations subsequently fly in all directions and walk-outs look on the cards as tensions mount leading to the payments being revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Laura Hamilton helps a family hunt for an ideal holiday home near Torrevieja on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. The end of the Spanish property boom raises hopes that the Framptons' budget of £150,000 will stretch farther than expected.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Christine Vaughan, who is looking for a holiday home in Barbados on a budget of £150,000 and also wants to generate income by renting out the property. However, the Caribbean island's sunny weather leaves Christine struggling to focus on business.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Wars of the Roses: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Nether Poppleton, Yorkshire: The Monastery and the Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Nether Poppleton near York in a bid to find out more about the village's origins. Residents are recruited to join in the excavations as the experts try to establish whether the settlement, mentioned in the Domesday Book as the land of St Everilda, dates back to the Anglo-Saxons.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Charismatic Australian vet Dr Scott Miller attends to the needs of more animals in his surgery in south-west London. A beagle puppy that has been left with a punctured eyeball and sliced lens seeks treatment, while vet Jo and nurse Gemma take a pregnant stray cat to foster carer Penny.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect continues his exploration of the world of small builds, meeting a man planning a bolt-hole in the Lake District, and visiting a community in Hackney, east London, in which people live and work in customised shipping containers. He also travels to a home in nearby Shoreditch where the kitchen has been moved onto the roof, and finds out how an Oxford resident has turned his back garden into a party palace using a caravan.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows a project to renovate and extend a classic 1920s cinema in Thorne, South Yorkshire. With little knowledge of restoration, Gwyn and Kate boldly set about turning the dilapidated building into a family home using masses of concrete after taking advice from an architect friend. The couple are hoping to create a hydraulic glass wall that opens up one side of the house to form a UV-filtered canopy, and there are also plans for a white roof extension that resembles a diving board.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Grasmere, chef Kevin Tickle goes foraging to cook some local dishes at his Forest Side restaurant, and in Wensleydale, gamekeeper David Hutchinson readies the estate for a shoot.(n)

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to two restaurants - Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea - to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress? Plus, an update on Finn McCool's from season one.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Grasmere, chef Kevin Tickle goes foraging to cook some local dishes at his Forest Side restaurant, and in Wensleydale, gamekeeper David Hutchinson readies the estate for a shoot.(n)
